Articles.Content:
So when I load my parts into KSP they look like they have some sort of lighting error, I think. ![:huh:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_undecided.gif) It looks like they each have their own shadow that only effect that part. Check it out:

![I4SxwhL.png](http://i.imgur.com/I4SxwhL.png)

![iiWJuVn.png](http://i.imgur.com/iiWJuVn.png)

I assume you made your mesh in Blender, and set it to smooth shading, correct?

If so, you need to add (but **do not** apply) a EdgeSplit modifier set to 30~60 degrees, so that the cylindrical ends of the fuel tank are sharp, while the curved sides remain smooth.
No, I used Wings 3D to make my model and my collider, then I added the mesh collider component in Unity. I'll try the edgesplit in Wings if there's a tool for it.
When you import it to Unity, try setting Normals to Calculate rather than Import, if it's not already.

> 
> I assume you made your mesh in Blender, and set it to smooth shading, correct?
> If so, you need to add (but **do not** apply) a EdgeSplit modifier set to 30~60 degrees, so that the cylindrical ends of the fuel tank are sharp, while the curved sides remain smooth.

Wow, I had no idea you didn't need to apply the modifier for it to work. That's great to know!

> 
> No, I used Wings 3D to make my model and my collider, then I added the mesh collider component in Unity. I'll try the edgesplit in Wings if there's a tool for it.

Select the ends of the parts, the edges and right click -> Choose hardness and set to hard.

![faf6163e26.png](http://puu.sh/hqpo0/faf6163e26.png)

These glitches are due to the ends of the models having soft edges.

**Soft**
